Description: Aboveground Net Primary Production: woody stem component (ANPP_woody_stem)
Parameters.Conditions: vegetation type: Trees, broadleaf evergreen; stand age: 10; biomass attributes: dbh trees >= 0 cm; soil texture: clay; soil type: Oxisol; soil notes: Red loamy laterite (oxisol) derived from metamorphic rocks. pH of 7.
Region.Regional.conditions: country: India; state/province/region: Meghalaya; nearest city: Burnihat; geographic coordinates: 26, 91.08333; elevation: 100 m; biogeographic zone: Asia; Koeppen climate zone: Cwa; FAO ecological zone: Tropical moist forest; mean annual temperature: 25.3 degrees C; annual precipitation: 2200 mm yr-1
Other.Properties: ForC site: Northeast India fallow field chronosequence (ID#: 1337); ForC plot: Forest recovery following slash and burn agriculture. 10 y (ID#: 1691); ForC measurement ID: 10132; Date of Measurement: 1979; disturbance type: Cultivation; regrowth type: Initiation of post-disturbance cohort (natural); regrowth year: 1969; variable description: Annual aboveground woody production accounting for stem growth but not branch fall;  i.e., wood (including branch) increment determined using allometric equations relating aboveground woody biomass increment to changes in stem diameter of all individual trees in the plot. Also known as "coarse woody productivity".;
